title: Sustainability Guidelines - National Geographic Society
summary: National Geographic is committed to sustainability and considers social and environmental impacts of all of its business decisions. title: Whole Foods Expands 'Sourced For Good' Label To Coffee - Store Brands Magazine
summary: Whole Foods Market is expanding its Sourced for Good certification to the coffee aisle, starting with 13 distinct blends of its private label coffee. The Sourced for Good seal signifies that the coffee has been sourced in a responsible way that benefits workers and the environment. All Whole Foods Market brand single-origin coffees will now include a Q Coffee mark and score of 86+ on the front of the package, indicating that they are consistently of specialty quality.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes an innovation that contributes to environmental sustainability goals by promoting responsible sourcing and environmental stewardship.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes an innovation that is a new or improved product or business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes a product that is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the article describes a process that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by promoting responsible sourcing and environmental stewardship.
product_or_process: Whole Foods Market brand coffee blends and single-origin coffees
likely_naics_codes: ['445110 - Supermarkets and Other Grocery (except Convenience) Stores', '424490 - Other Grocery and Related Products Wholesalers', '311999 - All Other Food Manufacturing', '493110 - General Warehousing and Storage']

title: 5 New technologies for beef producers - Successful Farming
summary: 1. Corral Technologies is a virtual fence company that uses GPS tracking and stimulation to keep cows within a virtual boundary. 2. AgResult is a cattle management software that helps farmers organize feed rations, track feed inventory, and manage bookkeeping. 3. Where Food Comes From (WFCF) is a third-party verification company that helps farmers build trust with consumers by verifying marketing claims.
green_innovation: TRUE. Corral Technologies and AgResult are both examples of green innovations because they help farmers reduce their environmental impact. Corral Technologies' virtual fence helps farmers reduce their carbon footprint by eliminating the need for physical fences, and AgResult's software helps farmers optimize their feed rations, which can reduce methane emissions from cattle.
business_innovation: TRUE. Corral Technologies, AgResult, and WFCF are all examples of business innovations because they are new or improved products or processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous products or processes.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe any green products.
green_process: TRUE. AgResult's software helps farmers optimize their feed rations, which can reduce methane emissions from cattle.
company: Corral Technologies, AgResult, Where Food Comes From (WFCF)

product_or_process: Virtual fence, cattle management software, third-party verification

title: Oshi Salmon-Inspired Fillets Make Debut in NYC's Coletta Restaurant - vegconomist - the vegan business magazine
summary: Israeli startup Oshi enters the American foodservice market with its salmon-inspired fillets, using 3D printing technology to create a plant-based alternative with similar nutritional value to traditional salmon, minus the environmental impact. Oshi's product launch takes place at Coletta, a high-end vegan Italian restaurant in New York City. The article highlights Oshi's commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship in developing its alternative seafood products.
green_innovation: TRUE. Oshi's salmon-inspired fillets are a green innovation because they contribute to the goal of reducing or replacing harmful substances, specifically by providing an alternative to traditionally farmed salmon, which can contain microplastics and mercury.
business_innovation: TRUE. Oshi's salmon-inspired fillets are a business innovation because they are a new product that is significantly different from the company's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE. Oshi's salmon-inspired fillets are a green product because they are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle, specifically by using plant-based ingredients and avoiding the environmental concerns associated with traditional salmon farming.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific green process implemented by Oshi.

title: New funds allow Merritt forestry company to get more value out of harvest - Merritt Herald
summary: The British Columbia government has announced funding for wood-product manufacturing and First Nations economies. Stuwix Resources is receiving up to $50,000 for planning activities toward implementing new processing approaches that will allow them to recover up to 35 per cent more marketable volume out of their tenure harvest. This will create a new business line, allowing them to do more on-site processing and decrease their wasted fibre.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the new processing approaches will allow Stuwix Resources to recover more marketable volume from their tenure harvest, and will allow them to explore new more sustainable markets such as bio energy, chips, shavings and firewood
business_innovation: TRUE, because the new processing approaches are a new business line for Stuwix Resources and will allow them to do more on-site processing
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a product
green_process: TRUE, because the new processing approaches will decrease wasted fibre

title: Nor-Feed makes progress in aquaculture - Aquafeed.com
summary: Nor-Feed, a French company founded in 2003, develops plant-based additives to eliminate the use of harmful substances in animal feed. Their plant-based additives have been successfully used in aquaculture, leading to improved growth, feed efficacy, and animal welfare. Nor-Feed's products include Nor-Grape (grape polyphenols), Nor-Spice AB (prebiotic), Durelax (for animal welfare), Norponin Opti (for ammonia control), and Norponin XO (for intestinal parasite control).
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing the use of harmful substances in animal feed and promoting animal welfare.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new product (Nor-Grape, Nor-Spice AB, Durelax, Norponin Opti, and Norponin XO) that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and that has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes products (Nor-Grape, Nor-Spice AB, Durelax, Norponin Opti, and Norponin XO) that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a process that meets the criteria to be a green process.

title: Dundee to smelt up to 230000t of copper â€“ Windhoek Observer - Windhoek Observer
summary: Dundee Precious Metals Tsumeb (DPMT) lost N$839.4 million in 2022 due to accounting impairments.  DPMT opened a General Waste Management Facility that will help the company move to an integrated waste management approach and help reduce the environmental footprint of the company's smelting operations. The company expects the facility to create nine new jobs and extend the life of the company's landfill.
